newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil to hold news conference on telcom selloffs.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to hold news conference on telcom selloffs.

text.p: Brazilian Communications Minister Sergio Motta will hold a news conference at 1100 local/1400 GMT to explain the ongoing privatization of Brazil's telecommunications industry, a ministry spokesman said.
"He's going to talk about telecommunications in general -- cellular, conventional, data transfer etc," the spokesman said.
Motta will also give an overview of the postal services' performance in 1996, he said.
The spokesman declined to comment on speculation in Brazilian markets that Motta would announce details of an official, supervisory committee to oversee privatization in the sector.

Brazil has asked would-be operators of 10 concessions to run cellular services to submit bids by April 7. It also intends to privatize a first unit of federal communications holding Telebras by the end of the year.
